text.0: Wæs. . . hāll A common Germanic form of salutation. So Andr. 914; OE. Gosp., Mat. 28.9, Luke 1. 28 (cp. Par. Lost v 385 ff.), La[yogh  ]amon's Brut 14309: Lauerd king, wæs hæil. Cf. Grimm, Deutsche Grammatik iv 356 (298 f. ); Stroebe, Beitr. xxxvii 190, 197 On wæs (= wes), see Lang.  § 7.1.
